Description: A model knife-blade: cut from thin sheet copper. There is a short tang at the butt and the other end is roughly cut off to a point.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 28, pl.IXA, 4. For other Early Dynastic model knives, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan I and Memphis V' (London, 1913), pl.V, 16; A. C. Mace in G. A. Reisner (ed.), 'The early dynastic cemeteries of Naga-ed-Dêr' II, (California, 1908), 47, fig. 108, (1) and pl.48a; J. Garstang, ‘Maḥâsna and Bêt Khallâf’ (London, 1989), pl.XXIII; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ II (1896-7), pl.XVIII, 1; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ I (Berlin, 1929), no. 135 and pl.7;J. de Morgan, ‘Recherches sur les Origines de l’Égypte II (Paris, 1896-7), 251, fig. 837; J. E. Quibell, ‘Archaic Objects’ (Cairo, 1905), no. 14543 and pl-59-
